thread.section_title: Nikkei Technology Online : tech news - straight from Asia.
thread.title: Daihatsu Launches New Light Vehicles

title: Daihatsu Launches New Light Vehicles
text:
Daihatsu Launches New Light Vehicles Sep 11, 2015 "Cast Activa" is an SUV type. [Click to enlarge image] "Cast Style" expresses an upper-grade quality. [Click to enlarge image] "Cast Sport" gives priority to driving performance. [Click to enlarge image] The "D Wrapping" technology was applied to the roof and roof side of the vehicle. [Click to enlarge image] 
Daihatsu Motor Co Ltd announced Sept 9, 2015, that it has released the "Cast" light vehicle on that day. 
The Cast was developed based on the new Move and designed in response to the needs of customers who put weight on individuality. It comes in three models: SUV (sport-utility vehicle)-type "Cast Activa"; "Cast Style," which expresses an upper-grade quality with plated decorations; and "Cast Sport," which gives priority to driving performance. 
The minimum ground clearance of the Cast Activa, which looks like an SUV, is 180mm, which is 30mm higher than that of the other two models. As a result, it has a high running performance on snowy and mountain roads. 
The Cast Style features a high-quality appearance because its front and rear bumper moldings and side rocker moldings have plated decorations. The Cast Sport realizes a high stability because Daihatsu optimized the shock absorber and the spring constant of the coil spring. 
For all of the three models, Daihatsu applied its "D Wrapping" technology to the roof, roof side and spoiler. The D Wrapping is used for decorating an auto body by attaching PVC (polyvinyl chloride) resin films to parts instead of painting them. It enables to add patterns looking like a carbon fiber fabric to iron and resin parts having three-dimensional shapes. 1
